pageTitle: Prime Ministerâ€™s itinerary for Friday, June 4, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

Private meetings.

11:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will address Canadians on the COVID-19 situation and hold a media availability. Minister of Public Services and Procurement Anita Anand, Chief Public Health Officer of Canada Dr. Theresa Tam, Deputy Chief Public Health Officer of Canada Dr. Howard Njoo, and Brigadier-General Krista Brodie will be in attendance.

Room 200
Sir John A. Macdonald Building
144 Wellington Street

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media wishing to cover the event must be accredited with the Parliamentary Press Gallery.
  • Journalists can dial in to listen and ask questions.
  • Participant dial-in numbers:
    Local: 613-954-9003
    Toll-free: 1-866-206-0153
    Pass code: 6822783#

4:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a virtual conversation with Ryerson University students and faculty at the Ryerson Democracy Forum. 

The event will be streamed live via the following link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UcGtNkfJp5k.
